title: What is the grace giving criteria in the RBSE 12 science board? - Quora

response.answer_text: Board has made a rule that if students is just nearby passing marks then teachers must pass them by giving grace marks but the important thing is that you must have written something in paper even if it’s wrong but it should be there. They want some material or content to give marks even if it is wrong.As many students are topper but due to one of the subject they get failed. For instance Some of them score easily in every subject except one which became a major problem for them. Be happy you will pass by grace marks only if you are nearly passing. But Board generally doesn't publish this news as most of the student will not work hard and in the namesake of grace marks, they would write the exam. I have prepared for 12th from OYEEXAMS, it’s an application available on Google play store, It provides us previous year solved Question paper, large Question bank, textbook solutions, and sample papers for RBSE BOARD. Here are some of their screenshots:

Basically grace marks are some extra marks given to you if your examiner feels that with a few more marks (2or3) your grade is going to change. For example if you get 72 (or B1) and 75 makes it A2 then the needful is done for your benefit.
